thread.title: Arsenal should make shock bid to sign Chinese Super League-bound Wayne Rooney, according to Harry Redknapp
thread.title_full: Arsenal should make shock bid to sign Chinese Super League-bound Wayne Rooney, according to Harry Redknapp

author: dfraser
title: Arsenal should make shock bid to sign Chinese Super League-bound Wayne Rooney, according to Harry Redknapp
text:
Comments ARSENAL should make shock bid to sign Chinese Super League-bound Wayne Rooney, according to Harry Redknapp. 
The former Tottenham boss reckons Rooney would be the perfect player for a leader-less Gunners squad. PA:Press Association 6 Harry Redknapp has urged Arsenal to consider signing Wayne Rooney 
Arsene Wenger has been in desperate need of player of the England man’s ilk this term – and is the necessary next step to getting his hands on the Premier League title once more, according to Redknapp . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal and Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
In his column for the Standard, Redknapp wrote: “Arsenal should take a gamble and sign Wayne Rooney on a two-year contract. 
“There’s no love lost between Jose Mourinho and Arsene Wenger, but Petr Cech moved between the two managers and Wayne deserves the chance to choose his next move. Manchester United star Rooney misses Europa League trip to St Etienne due to injury PA:Press Association Arsene Wenger is a long-time admirer of Manchester United's Wayne Rooney 
"It is pretty clear his time at Manchester United is coming to an end. 
"Jose is saying all the right things publicly but his team selections make it obvious he doesn’t fancy him and that’s his choice as manager. 
"He’s obviously a big player at the club but if you aren’t in the team, you are one step removed from all that and he won’t stand for it. Wayne Rooney is presented a trophy for being Manchester United leading all time top scorer Getty Images 6 Arsene Wenger's Arsenal are desperately lacking an on-pitch leader 
"Wayne always wants to play and that’s what made him great. He was a street footballer with the same hunger and desire as a kid in the playground. 
"It’ll be killing him to sit around as part of a squad, even if he has broken Sir Bobby Charlton’s goal-scoring record." 
Redknapp added that the move to China would be a massive mistake - much like Roy Keane had said before him - and added Rooney's experience would transform Arsenal 'overnight'. Sutton United 0-2 Arsenal : Sutton’s magical FA Cup run is ended in gritty encounter PA:Press Association 6 Harry Redknapp has urged Wayne Rooney to snub China and stay in England 
He said: "There’s a lot of talk about Rooney going to China but I can’t see that happening, at least not before Tuesday’s transfer window deadline. 
"I suppose they could have been working on a deal for a while which would help but it makes more sense to keep his options open until the summer. 
"And if Rooney is available then, the Gunners should come in for him. Wenger says Arsenal lost organisation in 5-1 beating by Bayern Munich PA:Press Association Wayne Rooney's time at Manchester United appears to be at an end 
"Arsenal looked at him a few years ago so we know Arsene is a fan. 
"He would improve that team overnight because they have an issue with attitude and he is a winner. 
"Everyone always says they have no leaders and that’s because it is true. Theo Walcott captained the team the other day. Harry Redknapp shows off his Dad Dancing moves in new video! AP:Associated Press 6 Arsenal have sorely missed an on-field leader like Tony Adams, says Harry Redknapp 
"Kieran Gibbs did the same for half an hour against Bayern Munich last week when Laurent Koscielny got injured. Neither of them are true leaders. 
"Say what you like about Wayne but his experience and will-to-win is up there with the very best. 
"Arsene always had Tony Adams or Patrick Vieira to set standards and call people out for him. Maybe Rooney could do that job for him now."
